item.title: Multiple paving slabs cracked and uneven, 17th October
item.description:
I and other neighbours were unaware that digging work was carried out on Tuesday, 14th October. While the lack of notice was not the main concern, we’ve since noticed that many of the paving slabs which were replaced afterwards appear to be damaged or cracked. This area experiences heavy footfall, particularly as it’s close to a school, so the uneven surface could present a safety issue. In addition, several of us have noticed that our broadband connections have been unreliable since the work took place that day. Could you please look into these issues and advise on any plans for repair or further inspection?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Lane, Plaistow, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumping of roadwork barriers not in use on public highway, 17th October
item.description:
There has been a collection if highways yellow barriers left innthe road outside my home (no. 8 st. Marys ave) for some weeks, and yesterday someone unauthorised moved them from the road to the pavement. In the dark this us dangerous particularly as the street light opposite us out of action. I am 87 years of age and should be very grateful if they could be taken away,. They are just parked, not in use. Thank you
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): South Hill Road, Shortlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Trees overhanging road and footpath, 17th October
item.description:
All the trees on this community green need to be pruned / cut back. They are overhanging the road by the bus stop and another tree has overgrown covering the footpath.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mounthurst Road, Hayes, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Illegal dumping of commercial waste in a bin disguised as domestic bin, 17th October
item.description:
I want to bring to your attention that this unmarked bin without a lid does not belong here, as there are only 4 houses in the front of this close. It has been put here by the renters of No.1 Lords Close for the past many years who operates a construction business to dispose of their construction waste (commercial nature) on a daily basis unloaded from their van, often along with food waste. As the bin does not have a lid, the contents often attract foxes..and rubbish is often dragged around scattering the road and flowerbed. Other residents constantly have to litter pick. This is illegal..a hazzard, and an abuse of limited public resources. Please have it removed. Thanks..

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Lords Close, Tulse Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Constant flytipping, 17th October
item.description:
There has been a constant fly tipping at the litter bins for weeks now. I am kindly asking if these bins can be monitored now. Also, kindly asking if they can be changed more regularly as they build up quickly due to being on a busy commuting road and by a bus stop.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eglinton Hill, Shooters Hill, London
Report on FixMyStreet
